name: Chateau ZZ's
raw_text:
Chateau ZZ's
Skip to content
About
Menu
Hours & Info
ZZ's Club
Reserve the Holidays
Private Events
Reserve a Table
Chateau ZZ's
Scroll to next section
The critically acclaimed Mexican fine-dining concept from Major Food Group
Situated inside a magnificent 20th-century chateau in the heart of Brickell, Miami, Chateau ZZ’s marks the reimagining of one of the most magnificent European-style manors in the United States, by the renowned Ken Fulk, which now features interiors that encourage sophisticated indulgence.
From theatrical tableside guacamole, vibrant raw-bar items like the signature Michelada oysters, celebratory entrées from the grill, and over 1,000 tequilas and mezcals, our chefs proudly prepare an array of tortillas, sauces, and other foundational Mexican recipes on premises every single day.
MENU
DINNER
DRINKS
Select a Menu
A LEGENDARY ADDRESS
Formerly known as Petit Douy, this architectural marvel was built in 1931 by renowned architect Martin L. Hampton and designated a historically protected building in 1983. The manor was the residence of John and Sheelah Murrel, noteworthy figures in the development of modern Miami, for more than fifty years. Now open to the public for the very first time, the reimagined estate is a collaboration between Major Food Group and Ken Fulk, Inc.
THE EXPERIENCE
A night at the Chateau is brought to life by MFG’s tuxedo-clad service captains across a variety of gorgeous environments that evoke the glamor and nostalgia of Hollywood’s golden era. Whenever you choose to visit, we hope to make your time with us as an occasion.
MAJOR FOOD GROUP
Founded a decade ago by Jeff Zalaznick, Chef Mario Carbone, and Chef Rich Torrisi, Major Food Group has consistently delivered the most celebrated, innovative, and exciting culinary experiences in the world. Together, the three visionary leaders deliver exceptional, delicious food and hospitality concepts that delight guests, define categories and, while creating distinguishable sense of place in every city, establish new standards for the industry.
While each brand this creative team brings to life is distinct, they all reflect MFG’s refined, celebratory, and thoroughly contemporary approach to its craft.
BE AMONG THE FIRST TO KNOW
Sign up to hear about exciting new updates from Chateau ZZ’s and Major Food Group.

Nightclub

Restaurant

Private Events

Restaurant
Executive Chef
Byron Rubio
Mangoâs South Beach isnât just a place to dineâitâs a destination where bold flavors, vibrant energy, and world-class entertainment come together. Our newly reimagined menu, led by Executive Chef Byron Rubio, elevates classic tropical cuisine with refined, high-quality ingredients and innovative preparations. Whether youâre indulging in fresh seafood, prime cuts, or handcrafted cocktails, every bite is designed to delight. Step into a dining experience thatâs as electrifying as the performances on our stage.
Read Chef Rubio's Bio
Hours of Operations
MondayâThursday
Bar 5pmâ5am | Restaurant 6pmâ11pm
â
FridayâSunday
Bar & Restaurant 12pmâ5am
DINING + ENTERTAINMENT: Main Bar Stage View
Experience the finest at Mangoâs with premium seating offering the best views of the main bar stage. Savor exceptional gourmet continental Latin cuisine in an elevated setting, creating the best Miami experience for celebrations, date nights, or simply enjoying great company.
Book Table
DINING + ENTERTAINMENT: Mezzanine Views
Enjoy a birdâs-eye view of the Band Front Stage or Main Bar Stage from our Mezzanine seating for two. Take in the electric energy from above while dining in an elevated setting. With gourmet cuisine and an unforgettable atmosphere, itâs perfect for romantic evenings, special celebrations, or simply sharing great moments together.
Book Table
DINING + ENTERTAINMENT: Band Front Stage View
Experience dinner at the heart of the action with exclusive band front seating. Enjoy gourmet cuisine and the unforgettable energy of Mangoâs, perfect for celebrations, date nights, or a memorable evening out.
Book Table
Classic Dinner at Mangoâs
Choose from two distinctive dining experiences with our Best Available Seating. Enjoy the vibrant energy of Ocean Drive at our open-air outdoor tables or savor a more intimate evening in the elegant Jungle Room. While this reservation does not include live entertainment, it offers the perfect setting to enjoy Mangoâs signature flavors, handcrafted cocktails, and unforgettable ambiance.

About the Business
Established in 2018. At El Camino, our guiding principle is to exceed our guest's expectations in all areas - food, beverage, and ambiance - and create an experience that will arouse and excite our guest's senses.  As a team, we are inspired by the culture and the heritage of Mexico.  To that end, we are passionate about bringing you an authentic experience not typically seen north of the border in chain restaurants.

We are committed to offering the freshest organic and local ingredients where possible, and we value local, artisan, indigenous and reclaimed offerings.  We are even taking the not so typical step of making our own tortillas, sauces, and anything else possible from scratch. The list of craft cocktails is truly Mexican and includes house made sangritas, a curated selection of agave spirits, a diverse selection of craft and Mexican beers.  In the end, it is all about sharing the food with the community of people who enjoy it.  Viva México!
…
Read more
Ask the Community
Ask a question
Q:
Is the happy hour ONLY in the bar area?  What time is a good time to get there on a Thursday to actually get a seat in the bar?  Thanks
A:
So it is the bar area for Happy Hour Monday-Sunday 4-7pm. There are a certain section of tables that do Happy Hour at the booths Monday-Friday but only until 6 instead of 7pm. If you get there between 4-430, you should be able to get a seat or two…
more
Steven I.

See 1 more answer
Q:
Are the beans cooked with meat?
A:
I do not think so. It tasted very commercial to me when I was there this past february. I come from a place where there are lots of Mexican restaurants and lots of taco trucks. This place does not compare.
David P.

Main Menu
Española Way
From tequila to tacos and everything in-between, Oh! Mexico brings authentic Mexican fare to Miami’s Española Way. Our restaurant is open for lunch, dinner and drinks daily.
TORTILLA SOUP / 13
Tomato, guajillo pepper, chicken broth, tortilla strips,
panela cheese, sour cream, diced avocado, crispy pork
crackling & smoky Pasilla pepper strips
GUACAMOLE
Classic
16
Hass avocado, tomato, onions, serrano peppers & cilantro
Oh! Mexico
18
Fresh hass avocados, tomatoes, charred corn, serrano
peppers, red onions, cilantro & roasted pumpkin seeds
APPETIZERS
Chips & salsa sampler
10
Crispy white corn tortilla chips served with pico de
gallo, green tomatillo salsa, homemade orejona
salsa, red chile de arbol salsa & 12 chiles salsa
Esquites
11
Char grilled corn kernels, red peppers, onion,
garlic, cilantro, all tossed in mayonnaise and topped
with cotija cheese & tajin spice.
Add: shrimp 6
Queso fundido
15
Melted Mexican cheese served with warm flour 
tortillas
Add: poblano pepper strips 3 - chorizo 5
Volcano
12
Crispy corn tortilla topped with melted Mexican
cheese & avocado, served with salsa verde
Add: chorizo 5 - steak 8  - shrimp 8
Quesadilla
17
Large flour tortilla filled with melted Mexican 
cheese topped with shredded iceberg lettuce, 
chipotle mayo, pico de gallo & Mexican crema
Add: chicken 6 -steak 8 - shrimp 8
Nachos
17
Large platter of crispy tortilla chips with cheese
sauce, pickled jalapeño, pico de gallo, refried black
beans, guacamole & cilantro sour cream
Add: chorizo 5 - chicken 6 - steak 8 - shrimp 8
Salads
Mexican Caesar
16
Romaine heart, red cabbage slaw, pico de
gallo, corn tortilla chips, queso fresco,
cotija cheese & chopped cilantro
Add: chicken 6 - steak 8 - shrimp 8
Chipotle Chopped Salad
17
Romaine and iceberg lettuce, roasted corn,
poblano peppers, red peppers, red onion,
avocado, green onions, cilantro tossed in a
chipotle mayo dressing and fried onions on top
Add: chicken 6 - steak 8 - shrimp 8
SEAFOOD APPETIZERS
Mexican Ceviche
19
Catch of the day, shrimp, lime juice, tomato, onion, 
cucumbers, cilantro, avocado, tortilla strips & 
saltine crackers
Green aguachile*
21
Citrus marinated shrimp, cucumber, red onion &
serrano chili-lime sauce
Shrimp cocktail Acapulco*
21
Poached black tiger shrimp, red Mexican style
cocktail sauce, avocado, tomato, cucumber, celery
& saltine crackers
TOSTADAS/18
Crispy shrimp
Beer battered shrimp, guacamole, chipotle mayo
& red cabbage slaw
Fresh seared tuna loin tostadas
Crispy tortilla topped with fresh seared tuna,
sesame seeds, chipotle aioli, avocado & crispy
fried leeks
Ceviche tostada
Fresh corvina ceviche, smashed avocado &
cilantro crema
TACOH!S
• Order of 3 tacos served with white rice & refried black beans •
You can choose your own tortilla: Soft corn, Soft blue corn or Flour tortilla
AL PASTOR
22
Slow roasted guajillo marinated pork, pineapple, onion
& cilantro, soft corn tortilla suggested
 (Contains Nuts)
CARNE ASADA
22
Grilled steak, white onion & cilantro, soft corn tortilla
suggested.
Add cheese 2
Cochinita pibil
23
Yucatan style slow roasted pork, pickled red onion 
& cilantro, blue corn tortilla suggested
Grilled shrimp
24
Char grilled shrimp, red onion, green and red pepper,
garlic mayo & cilantro, soft corn tortilla suggested
Shrimp enchipotlado
24
Chipotle stewed shrimp, pickled red cabbage
slaw & cilantro crema, flour tortilla suggested
Baja fish
24
Beer battered white fish, creamy coleslaw, garlic 
mayo & cilantro, flour tortilla suggested
Taco birria
24
Slow braised beef, melted Mexican cheese, birria
broth, onion & cilantro, soft corn tortilla suggested
Taco Gobernador
24
Sauteed shrimp mixed with peppers, onions,
garlic & melted Mexican cheese, served over refried
black bean puree, topped with avocado slices, soft
corn tortilla suggested
Baja chicken
23

MEXICAN SPECIALtIES
Enchiladas
26
Soft corn tortillas filled with chicken or cheese,
covered with your choice of green tomatillo sauce,
red guajillo pepper sauce or our homemade mole,
topped with Mexican cream and avocado. Served
with white rice & refried black beans
MOLE

black beans & warm corn tortillas
Cochinita pibil
28

Pescado a la talla

Guajillo pepper and garlic sauce, served with

Chile relleno

Tampiqueña steak*

A lava rock bowl filled with

tomatillo sauce, grilled nopales and 
bell peppers, onion, chorizo & 
Mexican cheese

FROM THE BORDER
CLASSIC BURGER

seed bun with fries

gallo, cotija cheese & Mexican crema
Flautas doradas de pollo

& cheese, topped with iceberg lettuce,

Quesabirria
24

Grilled chicken 22 - steak 25

BEER PAIRINGS & ETC.
LA ORIGINAL
ÁMBAR LAGER 4.5%
A refreshing Vienna Style Ámbar Lager with underlying notes of honey perfectly balanced with noble hops for a very clean finish.
NATIVO KEY
TROPICAL IPA 6.1%
An all day Suave IPA with exotic notes of mango, passion fruit, pineapple, lemon and lime that drinks refreshingly easy.
TROPIFLACA
LIGHT LAGER 3.9%
88 CALS • CRAFTED TO REDUCE GLUTEN
Refreshing with hints of lemon & citrus for a thirst quenching finish. Brewed using all natural ingredients.
TROPI CRYSTAL
PILSNER 4.9%
Clara, ligera y sabrosa. A light and crisply refreshing Pilsner brewed in 1928 by Cervecería La Tropical in Havana and now in Miami by its founders. Enjoy the authentic taste of Miami’s preferred cerveza.
SABROCITA
HAZY PALE ALE 6%
ORIGINAL AND BLOOD ORANGE
Tropical, with creamy characteristics & notes of papaya, guava, pomelo & mamoncillo. Slightly tart finish with Sabro & Citra hops.
TROPILINA
DOUBLE IPA 8%
High-octane with sweet hints of citrus, pineapple, guava & grapefruit. Balanced with Caramel & Munich malts.
LA SUAVE
GERMAN LAGER 5.9%
Complex malty notes, delicate floral aroma with subtle spice and a crisp, clean bitterness.
LA HAZY
HAZY IPA  7%
Light notes of apricot, sweet orange & passion fruit with a firm, hoppy bitterness.
DULCE SOUR
FRUITED SOUR 5.5%
4 FLAVORS AVAILABLE: KIWI MANGO PASSION FRUIT GUAVA, PINEAPPLE COCONUT, AÇAI LYCHEE
Burst of citrus rounded with juicy notes & hints of bready graham cracker. Finishes with a residual sweetness.
TROPICAL 50 LA NEGRA • NITRO
STOUT 5.5%
REGULAR OR ON NITRO
Velvety smooth, medium-bodied stout with roasted coffee notes & hints of creamy chocolate.
LA CHELADA
PILSNER CON LIMÓN 5.2%
Notes of lemon, lime, light honey & cracker. Choice of Tajín or salt rim.
LA GRANDE
TRIPLE WEST COAST IPA 10%
Full-bodied IPA with caramelized notes of guava, fig, prunes and honey culminating in a balanced blend of piney hops and sweetness.
TROPIWEIZEN
HEFEWEIZEN 5.8%
Creamy yet crisp wheat beer with hints of banana, clove & rustic bready notes. Finishes with a touch of nutmeg spice.
LA INGLESA
ENGLISH ALE (LOW ALC) 3%
A dark copper, low alcohol brew with balanced malt sweetness and traditional English hop bitterness.
LA ORIGINAL RESERVA
IMPERIAL ÁMBAR LAGER 11%
Aged up to 4 months in Bacardi Ocho rum barrels. Rich notes of oak, vanilla, & aged Caribbean Rum combine for a complex, yet mellow taste.
LA NEGRA RESERVA
IMPERIAL STOUT 11%
Aged for 9 months in High Rye Bourbon American Oak barrels from Kentucky. Rich notes of Bourbon, dark chocolate, plums, & Autumn spices.
MIAMI MAMI
COCKTAIL-INSPIRED ALE 8.2%
Matured over toasted coconut chips soaked in Bacardi Limón and Bacardi Coconut. Notes of coconut, grenadine, fruit punch and tropical aromatics. Served over ice.

VEGETARIAN

name: RosaNegra Miami
raw_text:
RosaNegra celebrates the essence of Latin American cuisine with a handcrafted menu that brings to life the flavors, textures, and traditions
of our land. Each dish is a journey through the most authentic corners of Latin America, inviting a soulful connection to our roots.
TOSTADA SET-UP
Pita bread · tajín tostadas · avocado salsa · plantain habanero salsa · jalapeño salsa.

Gallery
See more of our photos on instagram
Moreno’s Cuba Menu
For the Lovers of Cuban Cuisine
Hungry for some Cuban food? Get ready to explore our carefully curated Cuban menu. Available at affordable prices, you’re surely in for a treat.
Read More
Mouth-Watering Appetizers
Begin your meal by sampling some of the quintessential Cuban flavors from Moreno’s Restaurant menu. From Pulled Pork Tacubas – Cuban take on tacos, to our uniquely made savory Empanadas offered with variety of delicious fillings, majority of appetizers served at Moreno’s are available under $10.
Filling Entrees
There is so much more food to taste and enjoy! Our bursting in flavor Entrees are offered in hefty portions, just as you would get it at Abuela’s house. Be it Shrimp Al Ajillo, Ceviche Cubano or Mom’s Ropa Vieja, Moreno’s Cuba menu is here to titillate your tastebuds.
Delectable Desserts
End your meal on a happy note by ordering any of the delicious, homemade desserts from Moreno’s Restaurant menu. Moreno’s Coconut Flan is amongst our guests’ favorites.
An Exciting Collection of Drinks
You couldn’t get the complete Cuban experience without ordering our crafted cocktails. Explore Moreno’s Cuba menu to find some of the all-time favorite classic drinks, which originated in Cuba, such as Mojitos or Daiquiris, as well as our own signature creations, skillfully prepared for you by our expert bartenders.
Apart from cocktails, you will also find an array of beer and wine options. From locally brewed Havana Lager to Cuban style lager Hatuey, you will definitely find something you would love.
Read Less

FAQS
What is the most famous dish at Hell's Kitchen in Miami?
The Beef Wellington and Pan Seared Scallops are amongst the most famous dishes at Hell's Kitchen.
Is there a dress code?
While we do not enforce a dress code, many guests choose to dress up for this fine dining experience.
Does Hell's Kitchen in Miami have a Prix Fixe menu?
In addition to our main menu, we also have a Signature Prix Fixe menu with an optional wine pairing.

About the Business
Business owner information
Ashley L.
Business Owner
At Elote Lovers, we're all about bringing people together through bold flavors and comfort food with a twist! We started as a family-owned food truck business (Miami Roasted Corn) in 2011 and grew with years of dedication, hard work, and lots of corn! Our passion for authentic street food and creative flavors has been the heart of everything we do, which led to the expansion of Elote Lovers in 2019.

What started as a small family venture has grown into a place where tradition meets innovation. From our classic Mexican-style elotes to our loaded Crunchwraps, unique street eats, and Fresh Squeezed Lemonade, every bite is crafted with love, quality ingredients, and a little bit of heat!

Whether you're craving something spicy, cheesy, or sweet, there's something for everyone at Elote Lovers. We're proud to serve our community with fresh, flavor-packed food and a welcoming atmosphere that feels like home.

Come taste the difference, and join our family of flavor fanatics!

Elote Lovers - Store founded in 2019

Miami Roasted Corn Food Truck Family-Owned Since 2011 

We cater all events,  contact us for more information!

raw_text:
Barceloneta Miami
0

Our Story

UBER EATS

Our Story
Menu

UBER EATS
Open Menu
Close Menu
Our Story
Menu
Photos
UBER EATS
UBER EATS
Make a Reservation
Our Story
Menus
Photos
With foundations in the trendy Miami neighborhood of Sunset Harbour, Barceloneta is Miami’s popular go-to hub for Spanish Mediterranean tapas, seafood, arroz and original gin cocktails.
Make a Reservation
Tapas originated in the Catalonian region of Spain and are small plates typically consumed with wine or vermouth.
We combine traditional preparations with local ingredients for dishes that are authentic to both their Spanish origins and Miami setting.
Learn more about our story.
For those wanting a true Spanish Mediterranean escapade, Barceloneta is just around the corner.
Make a Reservation
Flowing onto the walkway, “La Terraza” is the go-to place for stylish Sunset Harbour locals. You’ll feel a real sense of community from the buzz of the neighboring restaurants. The full dining menu is available on the terrace, along with all of the Spanish cocktails, wines & beers.
Dine with us and share with friends & family the delicious tastes of Barceloneta.
The Terrace.
Afternoon or evening, the outdoor Lounge is a hotspot for people watching and lounging with a glass of Spanish wine or Gin cocktail, of course. The bar bites menu is available, as well as the full selection of drinks.
Come join us at our local’s favorite, alfresco Lounge.
The Lounge.
Barceloneta, famed for their Spanish Mediterranean influenced tapas and home to the city’s renowned G+T’s.
A diverse city, Miami Beach radiates a multicultural vibe. The Owners love this cosmopolitan attitude and have this flowing throughout the Barceloneta dining room. The venue is usually still buzzing with guests even at 1 AM, the kitchen takes last orders at midnight and the bar will only close once the last guest leaves. The full Lunch & Dinner menu are available in the dining room, with a collection of intimate and social tables to take a seat at.
Dining Room.
Created by Co-Owner Daniella Rezai, Barceloneta’s “La Barra” is renowned for its Gin & Tonics. Reputed in Miami, they encompass character and flair with their citrusy, floral tastes. Served in a traditional over-sized brandy glass, the cocktails offer a revitalized version of the classic cocktail. The bar’s wine collection is exclusively Spanish, as well as many of the liquors. The Bar Bites menu and also the Happy Hour menu are available here.
The perfect place to unwind, socialize and taste the wonderful flavors of the Mediterranean, in the cozy Sunset Harbour neighborhood.
The Bar.

Miami Beach 33139

Careers
Welcome to our table at the Restaurant Bar Hacienda Ramirez Cruz, where each dish on our menu is a reflection and materialization of the values and vision that Rafael Ramirez and Carmen Cruz instilled in the original hacienda. Our founders’ passion for sustainable agriculture and authentic Mexican culinary arts is vividly brought to life in every recipe. We carefully select organic, locally sourced ingredients to craft dishes that honor traditional flavors while embracing modern culinary techniques. This menu, curated with love and respect for our heritage, aims to transport you to the Mexican highlands, offering a taste of the legacy and the lush, vibrant essence of Hacienda Ramirez Cruz. Join us in celebrating a culinary experience that’s rich in history and abundant in flavor, where each meal is a festivity and a homage to our roots.
SEE THE FOOD MENU
Welcome to the sweet conclusion of your culinary journey at the Restaurant Bar Hacienda Ramirez Cruz. Here, our dessert menu is a cherished homage to Doña Carmen Cruz, known in her town for her savory recipes but revered by her family for the sweet creations she reserved for them. These treasured recipes, once shared only in the intimate gatherings of family celebrations, are now lovingly passed on to you. Each dessert has been crafted with the same passion and care that Carmen infused into her original dishes, blending tradition with a touch of modern flair. Enjoy these sweet treats, each a piece of our heritage, carefully preserved and now offered as a gift to our guests. Indulge in these desserts and experience the warmth of Hacienda Ramirez Cruz hospitality, continuing the legacy of Doña Carmen’s culinary excellence.
SEE THE DESSERTS MENU
At Hacienda Ramirez Cruz, each cocktail exemplifies our commitment to craftsmanship and tradition. Ingredients are meticulously selected and sourced from fertile lands, ensuring unparalleled freshness and quality. Our skilled bartenders artfully blend these elements to create drinks that embody our rich heritage, making every sip a celebration of our storied history and cherished values.
SEE THE COCKTAILS MENU
Our bottle service is designed to transport you directly to the famous lavish parties once thrown at the original hacienda. With an exquisite selection of premium spirits and fine wines, each bottle served at your table is an invitation to revel in luxury and celebration, much like the festive gatherings hosted by Rafael and Carmen Cruz. Our expertly curated bottle menu features the finest tequilas, vibrant mezcals, and other classic spirits that promise to elevate your dining experience to a celebration of abundance and joy. Indulge in this exclusive service, designed to recreate the grandeur and spirited atmosphere of Hacienda Ramirez Cruz’s most memorable soirees, making every occasion with us an unforgettable affair.
SEE THE BOTTLE SERVICE MENU

maduros, yuca, chorizo (add fried egg +2)
JAGUAR HANDCRAFTED SIGNATURE SAUCES
NUEVO
One of our classic sauces since 2005, this amazing aji amarillo sauce made with a yellow chile pepper from Peru gives our ceviches a special boost and a burst of flavor. It is the star of one of our most popular ceviches “Black Market” combined with corvina, shrimp and calamari. Use this sauce on fried calamari, grilled fish or as a dip for sushi & sashimi
ORIENTAL
This incredible sauce with delicious depths of flavor from roasted jalapeños and our secret mix of fresh herbs and spices pairs great with our tuna “Tiradito Lima”. Use it in everything including as a salad dressing and on top of grilled prawns, shrimp or fish. I myself pour it over carnitas tacos for a fresh and vibrant contrast and balance.
MERKEN
Made with smoked red chiles from Mapuche, Chile, this versatile sauce pairs well with many items. We confit the chiles in our special blend of garlic, onion, and homemade secret vinegar to give the smoked chiles a special tang that brings out the best-rounded flavor. At Jaguar we top the Guacamole with it and it brightens up the avocado and opens up the creaminess of the dish. We also use the oil from this sauce to grill our Quesadillas. I use it on top of fried eggs and also grilled zucchinis and grilled onions as well and every once in a while I use it to top of my burger combined with fried onions.
JAGUAR
a.k.a. “House Sauce” has been paired with our Chips since 2005. An addictive combination of tomato, caramel onions and chile de arbol from Mexico gives a new meaning to “can’t eat just one”. This amazing sauce is our go-to on chips and I myself use it on Chilaquiles even though it’s a bit spicy, the balance of the cream and cheese makes it a perfect breakfast.
MUERTE
Our spiciest sauce ever still manages to have unsurpassed flavor. It’s hot without overpowering the flavor of the sauce or the food it’s meant to enhance. Born while having fun with guests when they wanted something hot but we did not want to give them regular ol’ hot sauce, we created a sauce that’s spicy and full of bright & natural flavors. A couple of drops go a long way.
Recommendations by Chef Oscar del Rivero
All of our sauces are made from only fresh, natural, and organic ingredients and contain zero preservatives. They require to be refrigerated and consumed and enjoyed within 2 weeks

Frequently Asked Questions
Your queries answered
What is ExpiredDomains.com?
ExpiredDomains.com is a free online platform that helps users find valuable expired and expiring domain names. It aggregates domain data from hundreds of top-level domains (TLDs) and displays them in a searchable, filterable format. Whether you’re seeking domains with SEO authority, existing traffic, or strong brand potential, the platform provides tools and insights to support smarter decisions.
Is there a cost to use the platform?
No, the platform is completely free to use. You can browse listings, view metrics, and apply filters without needing to sign up or pay any fees. There are no hidden charges or usage restrictions.
Can I register domains directly through the site?
No, ExpiredDomains.com does not register domains itself. Instead, it connects you to trusted external registrars and marketplaces like GoDaddy. You’ll be directed to complete your purchase or place a bid through their platform.
How often is the domain data updated?

Frequently Asked Questions
Your queries answered
What is ExpiredDomains.com?
ExpiredDomains.com is a free online platform that helps users find valuable expired and expiring domain names. It aggregates domain data from hundreds of top-level domains (TLDs) and displays them in a searchable, filterable format. Whether you’re seeking domains with SEO authority, existing traffic, or strong brand potential, the platform provides tools and insights to support smarter decisions.
Is there a cost to use the platform?
No, the platform is completely free to use. You can browse listings, view metrics, and apply filters without needing to sign up or pay any fees. There are no hidden charges or usage restrictions.
Can I register domains directly through the site?
No, ExpiredDomains.com does not register domains itself. Instead, it connects you to trusted external registrars and marketplaces like GoDaddy. You’ll be directed to complete your purchase or place a bid through their platform.
How often is the domain data updated?
The domain data is updated daily to ensure you're always seeing the most current listings, prices, and metrics. This includes newly expired domains, auction updates, and fresh insights from third-party tools and proprietary systems.
What tools and filters are available on the platform?
You can filter domains by TLD, keyword, length, backlink profile, SEO score, traffic estimates, and more. The platform also includes proprietary metrics like Estimated Auction Price, BrandRank, and SEO Price, alongside trusted data from sources like MOZ and Majestic.

What is Chifa?
It originated in Peru and has become a popular and unique style of cooking.
Chifa Peruano blends traditional Chinese cooking techniques and ingredients with Peruvian flavors and ingredients, creating a delightful blend of flavors and textures.
TRY NOW
Tou 
Family
With over 40 years of experience, the Tou family combines Chinese tradition with Peruvian flavors. From Peru to Miami, their passion for cooking brings the authentic taste of Chifa. Their mission: to share the amazing flavor of Peruvian Chifa with the world.
Read more
We have catering
Because eating Chinese food is great, but eating Chifa is a whole new experience!
LEARN MORE

rrrdiscover more
the concept of Zuma was born as a result of one chef’s obsessive passion with Japanese cuisine and his conviction that London was the place to develop his take on traditional Japanese food. authentic but not traditional, the menu showcases a variety of dishes from its three kitchens; the main kitchen, the sushi counter and the robata grill.

KYU
Home
Services
Menu
Story
Reservation

Menu
Story
Reservation
Home
>
Menu
Menu
At its core, the Kyu Menu is all about rich flavors and vibrant presentations. Picture this: each dish is like a work of art, crafted with precision and an eye for detail. Whether it’s those visually stunning appetizers or hearty main courses that seem to dance on your plate, every bite tells a story. It’s like walking through an art gallery, but instead of paintings, you’re savoring delightful creations that celebrate the beauty of food.
What sets this menu apart is its attention to seasonal ingredients. Think farm-to-table freshness with a twist! Imagine biting into a dish where every ingredient is in harmony, singing the song of the season with every mouthful. It’s not just eating; it’s experiencing the essence of nature’s bounty. Plus, let’s face it: who doesn’t love a dish that’s not only delicious but also Instagram-worthy?
But wait, there’s more! The Kyu Menu doesn’t shy away from innovation, marrying flavors from different cultures. One minute you’re enjoying the warmth of a hearty stew, and the next, you’re tantalized by a zingy, spicy element that surprises you. It’s like taking your palate on a globe-trotting adventure without ever leaving your seat.
And the dessert choices? Oh, get ready for a sweet finale that’ll make you swoon. From rich chocolate creations to delicate pastries, each sweet bite is a delightful goodbye to your culinary journey. So, if you’re up for a meal that’s as much about storytelling as it is about dining, the Kyu Menu is calling your name!
Exploring the Cultural Fusion: The Rise of Kyu Menu in Modern Cuisine
What’s the secret sauce behind this rise? Well, Kyu Menu pulls inspiration from street food stalls in Bangkok, spice markets in Marrakech, and chic bistros in Paris. It’s like a delicious world tour that you can experience without ever leaving your favorite restaurant. Chefs today are daring to play with ingredients that were once limited to a certain region. Picture a spicy kimchi taco or a fragrant Moroccan curry paired with Italian risotto. These mash-ups not only tantalize your taste buds but also tell stories of cultural intersections.
Have you ever wondered how flavors from seemingly opposite cultures can create something spectacular? It’s all about balance and experimentation. Just as a good song mixes different melodies, Kyu Menu finds the perfect rhythm of sweet, salty, sour, and umami. Diners find themselves not just eating, but embarking on a culinary adventure that bridges gaps and fosters unity.
Kyu Menu: A Culinary Journey Through Japan’s Kirin-Style Dining
Think of the Kyu Menu as a charming narrative, where each dish plays its part in a delicious saga. It’s a curated selection that highlights the best of Japan’s culinary traditions, drawing inspiration from Kirin, a symbol of harmony and prosperity. Picture slurping up bowls of rich ramen, the noodles weaving through your taste buds like a well-written poem. Then there’s the tempura, perfectly crispy and light, akin to a gentle breeze on a warm day.
Curiosity piqued yet? The magic of the Kyu Menu lies not just in its flavors but in the craftsmanship behind each dish. It’s like watching an artist at work; every ingredient is handpicked, every technique honed to perfection. As you dive into this dining experience, you’re transported to an intimate corner of Japan, where every bite tells a story of dedication and passion.
Have you ever wondered what it feels like to savor a meal that embodies culture and tradition? At Kyu Menu, that’s exactly what you get. The presentation is an art form all its own—sushi beautifully arranged, inspired by nature’s landscapes, waiting to dance on your palate. And let’s not forget about the sake; it’s like the cherry blossom to your feast, adding that perfect finishing touch to your culinary adventure.
So, if you’re ready to embark on an unforgettable flavor journey, the Kyu Menu is calling your name—will you answer?
Unveiling Kyu Menu: The Secret Behind Scrumptious Japanese Course Meals
Now, what makes Kyu Menu so special? This traditional multi-course dining style, known as Kaiseki, takes you on a culinary journey. Each course is crafted with seasonal ingredients, reflecting nature’s bounty. Think of it like a beautiful symphony, where every note plays perfectly with the next. From the first course’s vibrant sashimi to the last course’s comforting matcha dessert, each plate is designed to tantalize your taste buds and evoke emotions.
But here’s the kicker—Kyu Menu is all about balance. It’s not just a feast for your mouth; it’s a feast for the eyes, too. Imagine the vibrant colors of pickled vegetables next to the rich gloss of soy-glazed fish. Every dish is artfully arranged, almost too pretty to eat—almost, but not quite! The interplay of flavors, textures, and colors is like an impressive dance of taste on your palate.
So, why should you try Kyu Menu? Because it’s a chance to savor Japan’s culinary heritage while indulging in a meal that feels special. Whether you’re celebrating a significant occasion or just treating yourself, experiencing Kyu Menu is like taking a mini-vacation for your senses. Why settle for the ordinary when you can explore the extraordinary? So go ahead, embark on this delicious adventure that lets you indulge in the heart of Japan, one course at a time.
The Art of Balance: How Kyu Menu Elevates Traditional Japanese Fare
Picture this: a carefully curated meal that flows like a beautifully composed piece of music. Each dish plays its part, bringing flavors, textures, and colors together in perfect unison. The magic lies in how Kyu Menu elevates classic ingredients, transforming them into something extraordinary. Think of it as an artist using a limited palette to create a stunning masterpiece. You’ll find staples like rice, fish, and seasonal vegetables, but each is presented with an innovative twist that keeps your taste buds tingling.
Ever heard the saying, “Less is more?” Kyu Menu embodies this philosophy. With an emphasis on simplicity, the focus shifts to the quality of each ingredient. It’s like stepping into an art gallery filled with minimalist sculptures—every piece tells a story, and every detail counts. You can taste the freshness of the ocean in the sashimi, feel the comforting warmth of the perfectly cooked rice, and enjoy the delicate crunch of seasonal pickles.
Savoring Simplicity: The Philosophy Behind Kyu Menu in Gourmet Restaurants
At its core, the Kyu Menu embodies the beauty of simplicity. Just like a perfectly ripened peach on a summer day, it’s all about showcasing the natural flavors without overwhelming your palate with complexity. The idea is to elevate everyday ingredients to extraordinary heights. Think about it: when you savor a dish that’s uncomplicated yet breathtaking, it’s like witnessing a master painter create a vibrant landscape with just a few strokes. This menu strips away the excess and lets every individual flavor sing.
But why does this minimalist approach resonate so deeply? It’s about authenticity. In a world where we often feel bombarded by choices, the Kyu Menu presents a refreshing escape. Each dish invites you to focus on the essence of the ingredients, giving a heartfelt nod to their origins. It’s like the difference between a flamboyant fireworks display and a simple candlelit dinner—a little bit of elegance can go a long way.

JUNMAI DAIGINJO TK40 GENSHU ENSHINBUNRI 'HIKARI'
The rare hybrid rice grain, Koshitanrei, is polished to 40% of its original size to produce this premium sake. Elegant floral flavors of orange blossom, elderflower, and white tea are found in this powerful genshu, or undiluted sake.

680

DAIGINJO YK35 SHIZUKU
The most sought-after rice grain, Yamada Nishiki, is polished to 35% of its original size to produce this premium sake. The sake is extracted through a slow drip process that highlights delicate flavors of lychee, honeydew and pear. Fruit forward and amazingly smooth.

560

What is Chifa?
It originated in Peru and has become a popular and unique style of cooking.
Chifa Peruano blends traditional Chinese cooking techniques and ingredients with Peruvian flavors and ingredients, creating a delightful blend of flavors and textures.
TRY NOW
Tou 
Family
With over 40 years of experience, the Tou family combines Chinese tradition with Peruvian flavors. From Peru to Miami, their passion for cooking brings the authentic taste of Chifa. Their mission: to share the amazing flavor of Peruvian Chifa with the world.
Read more
We have catering
Because eating Chinese food is great, but eating Chifa is a whole new experience!
LEARN MORE

What is Chifa?
It originated in Peru and has become a popular and unique style of cooking.
Chifa Peruano blends traditional Chinese cooking techniques and ingredients with Peruvian flavors and ingredients, creating a delightful blend of flavors and textures.
TRY NOW
Tou 
Family
With over 40 years of experience, the Tou family combines Chinese tradition with Peruvian flavors. From Peru to Miami, their passion for cooking brings the authentic taste of Chifa. Their mission: to share the amazing flavor of Peruvian Chifa with the world.
Read more
We have catering
Because eating Chinese food is great, but eating Chifa is a whole new experience!
LEARN MORE

XO Sauce
XO Sauce
Derived from the famous digestif and its Extra Old 'XO' classification, XO sauce was first created in Hong Kong in the early eighties. Its extravagant ingredients include dried aged scallops, and dried shrimp that makes the sauce deep and rich in intensity. A luxurious condiment of the highest degree, Vogue China called it 'caviar of the East'

The Qianlong Emperor (乾隆帝), born on the 25th of September of 1711, was the fifth emperor of the Manchu-led Qing Dynasty, and the fourth Qing emperor to rule over China. The fourth son of the Yongzheng Emperor, he reigned officially from 1736 to 1795.
Despite his retirement, however, he retained ultimate power until his death in 1799, making Qianlong the
longest reigning Emperor in Chinese history. Although his early years saw the continuity of an era of prosperity in
China, he held an unrelentingly conservative attitude.
Many recognize Qianlong as one of the best emperors China has ever had.

PEKING DUCK
History
Peking Duck has earned its place in the list of the most famous and delicious dishes worldwide. Its history originates in the early 1200s in Beijing. At the time, this incredible dish was only available to the imperial family and some members of the upper class, as only the imperial chefs knew how to prepare it.
As story tells it, with the fall of the imperial system in China, the recipes of the Peking Duck were smuggled out of the Forbidden City, and became available to the masses.
Today, Peking Duck remains one of China’s best-known dishes, and a must-try for tourists trekking all the way to Beijing. Luckily, you don’t have to fly 8,000 miles to try this delicacy, as we have brought the Peking Duck to Doral.
To reserve your Peking Duck, call us at (305)-477-8188.
HOURS
MONDAY - SATURDAY
11:00Am - 10:00pm
SUNDAYS
12:00pm - 10:00pm
ABOUT US
Qianlong follows a tradition born in China, when our Moy family started working in the food industry before emigrating in 1957. Since then, we have owned and operated a number of restaurants in the United States and Venezuela. Deeply rooted in the flavorful Chinese culinary heritage and committed to absolute customer satisfactions, all dining enterprises have been embraced by generations in search of quality ingredients freshly cooked to order.
OUR HISTORY
Our family has a long culinary heritage, which started in the Canton Province. After working in the food industry in China, my grandfather Moy Chin Yen and our family emigrated to Venezuela in 1957. Shortly after, we opened the first of many restaurants, called Los Farolitos (The Beacons), in Maracaibo. Only two years later, our family opened El Palmar (The Palm Grove), in the capital city of Caracas. Although originally a steakhouse, the service quickly switched to Chinese food, and soon turned into a sample in the Venezuelan capital.
Over the years, El Palmar became more than a restaurant and our family became major players in the Chinese cooking in Venezuela. The location became known as “the restaurant of the presidents” due to the liking the country heads of state took to it. The place where presidents dined also offered a relaxing and warm atmosphere becoming a landmark place for families to gather and enjoy freshly cooked Cantonese meals.
Moy Chin Yen aided by his sons, expanded into United States, opening House of Moy in New York as well as another venture in Houston. We utilized our business acumen for innovation and culinary traditions, becoming pioneers in their own right. We were responsible for having brought Peking duck to Venezuela from New York, a dish previously unavailable in the Latin-American country. Cook to perfection, close to 100 Pecking ducks would be sold out in a daily basis.
I am the youngest restaurateur, Yony Moy, followed the steps of my grandfather Chin Yen and father Federico, opening five more restaurants and keeping a culinary and family enterprise alive for what today spans over six decades. This tradition still lies in the hands of myself, who came to Miami in 2008 and opened Qianlong in Doral. Qianlong was built upon the promises of customer service, a warm ambience and freshly cooked food in the same way as the previous venture were, and was welcomed with open arms by not only the Venezuelan community but by everyone who seeks to indulge in the flavors of Cantonese food.
LOCATION
We are located at 8726 NW 25TH ST in Doral. We are next to the Commerce Bank in the plaza with the blue rooftop. In case you cannot find our restaurant, please call us at (305)-477-8188.
.
www.qianlongrestaurant.com         |        (305) 477 8188          |        qianlongdoral@gmail.com

name: Ricky Thai Bistro
raw_text:
Ricky Thai Bistro | Thai Restaurant in North Miami, FL 33181 - Menu
Home
Menu
About Us
Menu
Download Menu
APPETIZERS
THAI SPRING ROLLS     8
Five crispy rolls hand rolled house stuffed with ground pork, clear noodles, and mixed vegetables.
VEGETABLE SPRING ROLLS      8
Five crispy rolls hand rolled in house stuffed with clear noodles and mixed vegetables.
RICKY THAI WINGS      11
Six or more depending on the size “
House Special
” chicken wings deep-fried until crispy, marinated on the spot and served with our
House Made Sweet Chili Sauce
on the side.
Chef suggestion:
If you like them
SPICY
please ask us for a side of
Sriracha sauce
!
FRIED TOFU     9
Sliced tofu (NO GMO) deep fried until crispy, served with our House Made Sweet Chili Sauce on the side.
SATAY CHICKEN     12
Four grilled chicken skewers, marinated with curry powder, kaffir leaves, and
coconut milk
, served with our signature
house made peanut sauce
and sweet chili relish.
LARP     15
Northeastern Thai,
spicy and sour
salad made with one choice of ground beef, pork or chicken, marinated with lime juice, roasted rice powder, Thai herbs, and spices.
Chef suggestion:
Delicious with a side of
sticky rice
(please allow proper time to cook) and a cold
BEERLAO, it should be prepared HOT or THAI HOT but not less than MEDIUM!
NAM SOD      15
Lightly spicy
ground pork salad marinated with Thai chili jam, ginger, lime juice, red onions, roasted peanuts, Thai herbs and spices.
Chef suggestion:
Try it with a cold
CHANG
beer!
SALADS
GREEN PAPAYA SALAD – SOM TAM     15
Shredded green papaya mixed traditional way in the Thai mortar with tomatoes, ground peanuts, fish sauce, lime juice and palm sugar.
Add salted crabs for $1, upon request can be made Laos style.
Chef suggestion:
You should order it
SPICY
, with a side of
sticky rice
(please allow proper time to cook) and a cold
SINGHA
beer!
HOUSE SALAD     7
Fresh romaine lettuce, tomatoes, cucumbers and carrots served with a side of our
“HOUSE MADE GINGER or PEANUT DRESSING”
YUM GOONG SALAD     15
Lightly Spicy
shrimp tossed with Thai chili jam, red onions, Thai herbs and lime juice.
YUM PLA MUK SALAD     15
Lightly Spicy
squid tossed with Thai chili jam, red onions, Thai herbs and lime juice.
YUM TALAY SALAD     15
Lightly Spicy
mixed seafood (shrimp, squid and green shell mussels) tossed with Thai chili jam, red onions, Thai herbs and lime juice.
Chef suggestion:
All the
YUM SALADS
are delicious with a glass of cold
PROSECCO
!
SOUPS
All soups are individual size except for KUAI TIAO NUEA which is the size of an Entrée.
TOM YUM GOONG     9
Shrimp in
lightly spicy
and sour soup with mushrooms, fresh Thai herbs and lime juice.
TOM YUM KAI     8
Chicken in
lightly spicy
and sour soup with mushrooms, fresh Thai herbs and lime juice.
TOM KHA KAI     8
Chicken in
lightly spicy
and sour coconut soup with mushrooms, fresh Thai herbs and lime juice.
TOM KHA GOONG     9
Shrimp in
lightly spicy
and sour
coconut milk
soup with mushroom, fresh Thai herbs and lime juice.
TOM KHA PAK     8
Mixed vegetables in
lightly spicy
and sour
coconut milk
soup with fresh Thai herbs and lime juice.
TOM KHA TOFU     8
Tofu in
lightly spicy
and sour
coconut milk
soup with mushroom, fresh Thai herbs and lime juice.
VEGETABLES SOUP     8
Vegetable soup with our daily fresh selection of vegetables and an Asian twist.
KUAI TIAO NUEA     15
Traditional beef noodle soup with bean sprouts, scallions, roasted garlic and cilantro
ENTREES
All Entrees are served with authentic Thai Jasmine White Rice.
No rice for Thai Noodles or Fried Rice.
CHICKEN
BEEF (ANGUS BEEF)
PORK
TOFU (no GMO)
MIXED VEGETABLES

please add

please add $2

On some
Thai
Stir Fried Specialties
we also offer a choice of
Fish fillet
, please ask your server for details.
We use the following vegetables in our preparation:
BROCCOLI, ORGANIC CARROTS, ZUCCHINI, ONIONS, RED BELL PEPPERS, GREEN BEANS and in some dishes BAMBOO SHOOTS
; since every
ENTREE
is prepared to order you can let your server know if you have any preference for the vegetables.

for each additional choice.
PAD THAI     18
Rice noodles sautéed in the wok with our
LIGHTLY SWEET house made Pad Thai sauce
, eggs and ground peanuts, garnished on top with bean sprouts, scallions, cilantro and a wedge of lime.
PAD KEE MOW – DRUNKEN NOODLES     19
Flat wide rice noodles sautéed with fresh basil, fresh vegetables and bamboo shoots garnished on top with bean sprouts, scallion and cilantro.
LIGHTLY SPICY
.
PAD SEE EW     19
Flat wide rice noodles sautéed with eggs, Chinese Broccoli and roasted garlic, garnished on top with bean sprouts, scallions and cilantro.
PAD WOON SEN     18
Clear thin noodles sautéed with eggs, bamboo shoots, fresh vegetables and roasted garlic, garnished on top with bean sprouts, scallion and cilantro.
FRIED RICE DISHES
All dishes can be made with
ONE
choice of
CHICKEN, PORK, BEEF, TOFU OR MIXED VEGETABLES
.
For
SHRIMP
or
SQUID
please add
$3
.
ANY COMBINATION please add $2 for each additional choice.
ANY COMBINATION with SHRIMP will get a full count of shrimp; please add $2 for each additional choice.
THAI FRIED RICE      17
Quick fried in the wok with onions, eggs and roasted garlic garnished on top with bean sprouts, scallions and cilantro.
THAI BASIL FRIED RICE     19
Quick fried in the wok with our house made basil sauce, fresh Thai basil, bamboo shoots, fresh mixed vegetables and garnished on top with bean sprouts, scallions and cilantro.
LIGHTLY SPICY
.
PINEAPPLE FRIED RICE     19
Quick fried in the wok with onions, eggs, pineapple chunks, roasted cashew nuts and roasted garlic, garnished on top with bean sprouts, scallions and cilantro.
GREEN CURRY FRIED RICE
21
Quick fried in the wok with red bell pepper, green curry paste,
coconut milk
and fresh Thai basil.
LIGHTLY SPICY.
THAI CURRIES
All dishes can be made with
ONE
choice of
CHICKEN, PORK, BEEF, TOFU OR MIXED VEGETABLES
.
For
SHRIMP
or
SQUID
please add
$3
.
ANY COMBINATION please add $2 for each additional choice.
ANY COMBINATION with SHRIMP will get a full count of shrimp; please add $2 for each additional choice.
GREEN CURRY     20
Definitely green, it is not necessarily sweeter than other Thai curries but, although the spiciness varies, it tends to be more pungent than them, it is one of the basic Thai curry styles. Prepared with, bamboo shoots, fresh vegetables (no broccoli), Green Curry paste and
coconut milk
.
LIGHTLY SPICY
.
RED CURRY     20
This is the most popular dish among Thai people. Prepared with bamboo shoots, fresh vegetables (no broccoli), Red Curry paste and
coconut milk
, you should definitely have it “pet, pet” (Thai hot).
LIGHTLY SPICY
.
MASSAMAN CURRY     20
Royal style curry with bell peppers, onions, carrots, potatoes, cashew nuts, Massaman Curry paste and
coconut milk
.
LIGHTLY SPICY
.
PANANG CURRY     20
It is a type of Thai curry that is milder than other Thai curries. Prepared with fresh vegetables, Panang Curry paste,
coconut milk
and fresh kaffir leaves.
LIGHTLY SPICY
.
THAI STIR FRIED SPECIALTIES
All dishes can be made with
ONE
choice of
CHICKEN, PORK, BEEF, TOFU OR MIXED VEGETABLES
.
For
SHRIMP
or
SQUID
please add
$3
.
ANY COMBINATION please add $2 for each additional choice.
ANY COMBINATION with SHRIMP will get a full count of shrimp; please add $2 for each additional choice.
GARLIC SAUCE     18
Fresh mixed vegetables (broccoli, zucchini, onions, red bell peppers, carrots and green beans) stir fried in the wok with our special house made garlic sauce.
BASIL SAUCE     18
Stir fried in the wok with our special house made basil sauce, fresh mixed vegetables (broccoli, zucchini, onions, red bell peppers, carrots and green beans), bamboo shoots, and fresh Thai basil.
LIGHTLY SPICY
.
GINGER SAUCE     18
Fresh ginger, mushrooms and fresh mixed vegetables (broccoli, zucchini, onions, red bell peppers, carrots and green beans) stir fried in the wok with our special ginger sauce.
CASHEW NUT SAUCE     18
Roasted cashew nuts, fresh mixed vegetables (broccoli, zucchini, onions, red bell peppers, carrots and green beans) stir fried in the wok, you should definitely order it with chicken!
BROCCOLI AND OYSTER SAUCE     18
Broccoli, onions and carrots stir fried with oyster sauce; it is delicious with beef!
PAD PRIK KING SAUCE     18
Stir fried in the wok with green beans, bell peppers and onions, a special chili paste and fresh kaffir leaves.
LIGHTLY SPICY
.
MIXED VEGETABLES     18
Quick toss in the wok with our special house made sauce and our fresh selection of vegetables (broccoli, zucchini, onions, red bell peppers, carrots and green beans).
.
RICKY SPECIALS
DUCK BASIL     26
Roasted duck, deboned and deep fried until crispy, served with a side of our special
house made basil sauce,
fresh vegetables, bamboo shoots and fresh Thai basil.
LIGHTLY SPICY
.
DUCK CURRY     26
Roasted duck, deboned and deep fried until crispy, served with a side of our Red Curry sauce made with Red Curry paste, coconut milk, fresh vegetables, bamboo shoots and chunks of pineapple.
LIGHTLY SPICY
.
FISH BASIL     MP
Fried whole fish (please ask for our daily selection) topped with our special
house made basil sauce
. Please allow proper time to cook.
LIGHTLY SPICY
.
THAI CHILI FISH     MP
Fried whole fish (please ask for our daily selection) topped with our special
house made Thai chili sauce
. Please allow proper time to cook.
FISH GINGER     MP
Fried whole fish (please ask for our daily selection) topped with our special house made ginger sauce. Please allow proper time to cook.
SEAFOOD BASIL     22
Shrimp, squid and green shell mussels, stir fried in the wok with our special house made basil sauce, fresh mixed vegetables, bamboo shoots and fresh Thai basil.
LIGHTLY SPICY
.
VOLCANO SEAFOOD     22
Shrimp, squid and green shell mussels, stir fried in the wok with our house made volcano seafood sauce, fresh mixed vegetables and fresh Thai herbs.
LIGHTLY SPICY
.
KAO NIAO MOO TOD     25
Special dish from the region of Isaan (Northeast of Thailand) which consists of deep-fried house marinated pork strips, sticky rice and papaya salad.
KAO PAD POO (CRAB FRIED RICE)     22
Special Fried Rice quickly tossed in the wok with real crab meat, diced carrots and celery garnished on top with cilantro, scallions and a wedge of lime.
ROASTED CHILI PASTE CHICKEN      21
Chicken stir fried in the wok with a special Thai chili paste, fresh mixed vegetables and fresh Thai herbs.
LIGHTLY SPICY
.
SIDE ORDERS
THAI JASMINE WHITE RICE
3

Pao by Paul Qui
Award Winning, 
            Modern Asian
Taste a series of audacious combinations brought to life by charcoal and smoke. Fusing Filipino, Spanish, Japanese, and French flavors, Pao creates a bold and visionary brand of contemporary Asian cuisine enhanced by captivating ocean views.
Hours & Info
Key
Value
Tuesday - Saturday
7:00 p.m. - 10:00 p.m.
Dress Code
Elegant Chic - no shorts, sandals (open-toe shoes) or beachwear
Seating
Indoor and outdoor seating available
Parking
Valet available

+1 786 655 5600
[email protected]
3201 Collins Ave
Miami Beach, FL 33140
The Chef
Paul Qui
Paul Qui takes a modernist approach toward food that’s equally playful and authentic, visionary and inspired by tradition. Born in Manila, trained in classic French and Japanese cuisine, Qui is a master at blurring lines between international flavors, fostering culinary innovation.
Reviews
I absolutely LOVED Pao. The service was fantastic & ambience was very lively. The food was delicious & I left wanting to try the Foie Gras since I was so full. I will be returning!
Opentable
Reviews
Memorable service and beautiful ambience. Food was presented exquisitely. The Wagyu Carpaccio was by far my favorite dish.

Reviews
My recent stay at the Faena Hotel Miami was nothing short of exceptional. Everything from our room accommodations, to the service, and to meals was outstanding. I highly recommend dining at the Faena's Pao restaurant.

Do they close early? I tried to order and call at 9 pm and no one answered?

Experience the most famous Peruvian restaurant in the world.
Redefining Miami Dining
CELEBRITY CHEF JUAN CHIPOCO – ONE OF MIAMI’S MOST SOUGHT AFTER CULINARY FIGURES – BRINGS YOU HIS UNIVERSE EXPRESSED IN THE FORM OF PERUVIAN DELICACIES.  FLAVORFUL, HIGH QUALITY INGREDIENTS, SKILLFUL PREPARATION AND AN EXCITING ATMOSPHERE MAKES OF CVI.CHE 105 ONE UNMISSABLE DESTINATION THAT CONTINUOUSLY DELIGHTS LOCALS AND TOURIST ALIKE FOR 15 YEARS IN A ROW.

About the Business
This gem is an absolute winner! Thai is a dime a dozen in Miami and theirs is truly superb. ATK pays special attention to the integrity of their ingredients and it definitely shows. These little geniuses have single handedly put many places to shame! The food is delicious and the presentation is just lovely! There is never such a thing as over ordering- if your leftovers make it past 3am fridge raids, your willpower deserves respect.

Cookie and Privacy Settings
How we use cookies
We may request cookies to be set on your device. We use cookies to let us know when you visit our websites, how you interact with us, to enrich your user experience, and to customize your relationship with our website.
Click on the different category headings to find out more. You can also change some of your preferences. Note that blocking some types of cookies may impact your experience on our websites and the services we are able to offer.
Essential Website Cookies
These cookies are strictly necessary to provide you with services available through our website and to use some of its features.
Because these cookies are strictly necessary to deliver the website, refuseing them will have impact how our site functions. You always can block or delete cookies by changing your browser settings and force blocking all cookies on this website. But this will always prompt you to accept/refuse cookies when revisiting our site.
We fully respect if you want to refuse cookies but to avoid asking you again and again kindly allow us to store a cookie for that. You are free to opt out any time or opt in for other cookies to get a better experience. If you refuse cookies we will remove all set cookies in our domain.
We provide you with a list of stored cookies on your computer in our domain so you can check what we stored. Due to security reasons we are not able to show or modify cookies from other domains. You can check these in your browser security settings.
Check to enable permanent hiding of message bar and refuse all cookies if you do not opt in. We need 2 cookies to store this setting. Otherwise you will be prompted again when opening a new browser window or new a tab.
Click to enable/disable essential site cookies.
Other external services
We also use different external services like Google Webfonts, Google Maps, and external Video providers. Since these providers may collect personal data like your IP address we allow you to block them here. Please be aware that this might heavily reduce the functionality and appearance of our site. Changes will take effect once you reload the page.

name: Yue Chinese
raw_text:
Menu | Yue Chinese Fusion
Home
Menu
About
Contact
Select Page
Embark on a culinary journey where tradition meets innovation in every bite. At Yue, each dish is crafted to offer a perfect balance of flavor and artistry, making every meal an unforgettable experience. The menu was developed to reflect both heritage and innovation, aiming to introduce miami to a new era of Chinese dining.
Menu
Our menu offers unique  traditional Chinese flavors with modern culinary techniques, crafted to delight your senses. Each dish is thoughtfully prepared using the finest ingredients, blending creativity and authenticity.
→
Signature Dishes include show-stopping and theatrical presentations, and a menu rooted in tradition with a twist.
Starters
Chef’s Specials
Sichuan Boiled Beef
A classic dish from Sichuan cuisine, featuring tender slices of beef poached in a rich, spicy broth infused with chili oil, Sichuan peppercorns, garlic, and doubanjiang (fermented chili bean paste). Served over a bed of vegetables, it’s known for its bold flavors, numbing spiciness, and fragrant aroma—a perfect balance of heat and umami.
Sichuan Poached Fish
A signature Sichuan dish featuring tender fish fillets gently poached in a tangy, spicy broth made with pickled mustard greens, chili oil, garlic, and Sichuan peppercorns. The soup is both sour and savory, with a refreshing aroma and a subtle numbing heat that perfectly complements the delicate texture of the fish.
Black Pepper Mango Beef Cubes
Tender cubes of beef stir-fried with fresh mango and crushed black pepper, creating a bold and aromatic fusion of savory, sweet, and spicy flavors. The juicy mango balances the heat of the black pepper, while the beef adds richness—an unexpected yet harmonious blend of tropical fruit and robust seasoning.
Sweet and Sour Osmanthus Pork
A refined twist on the classic sweet and sour pork. Tender pork strips are lightly battered and fried to a golden crisp, then glazed in a tangy-sweet sauce accented with osmanthus syrup. The dish combines fruity aroma, crispy texture, and a delicate floral note, offering a harmonious balance of flavor and elegance.
Chongqing Spicy Chicken
A fiery and flavorful dish from Chongqing, featuring crispy fried chicken pieces tossed with a mountain of dried chili peppers, Sichuan peppercorns, garlic, and aromatic spices. Known for its bold heat and numbing sensation, this dish delivers a crispy texture and an addictive, punchy flavor that’s a hallmark of Sichuan cuisine.
Crab Roe Xiao Long Bao Dumplings
A luxurious take on the classic soup dumpling, filled with a rich mixture of minced pork, crab meat, and crab roe, along with a savory broth. Wrapped in a delicate, thin skin and steamed to perfection, these dumplings offer an indulgent burst of ocean flavor with every bite—elegant, juicy, and deeply satisfying.
Signature Dishes
Peking Duck
Rose Suger Peking Duck, Our signature duck is infused with subtle floral notes, dry-aged and slow-roasted until glassy crisp. Served with delicate rose-scented suger, fluffy pancakes, zingy hoisin sauce, crunchy cucumbers, and spring scallion. Bold, rich, and Insta-worthy — classic taste meets modern vibes.
Cumin Leg of Lamb
Tender slices of lamb leg, infused with toasted cumin and a bouquet of Chinese herbs. Finished with a kiss of flame and a touch of rose salt — rich, rustic, and refined.
SAVOR EXOTIC NORTHERN CHINESE CUISINE ON ESPANOLA WAY
Location
447 Española Wy, Miami Beach, FL 33139
Hours
Mon: 12PM – 11:00PM
Tue-Wed: 4PM – 11:00PM
Thur-Sun: 12PM – 11:00PM
Contact
(305) 929-8552

JOIN OUR TEAM
MENUS
SUMMER SPICE
COCKTAIL & HAPPY HOUR
BRUNCH SPECIALS
DINNER MENU
Phuc Yea is throwing its own spice party this summer.
This isn’t a prix-fixe—it’s a damn mood. Bold flavors dripping in heat, dishes that flirt with your senses, and a table that feels more like a vibe than a meal.
No labels. No rules. Everyone else can chase Spice, but we’re here to stir it.
DOWNLOAD PDF
Bonus: Add a ‘Tini With a Snack for Just $15
What sets this experience apart? For a limited time, guests can kick things off with a signature martini and a paired snack—curated by Phuc Yea’s award-winning bar team—for just $15 (normally $24). It’s not just a drink. It’s a vibe. Created by four different bartenders, each ‘tini brings a distinct personality—whether it’s the Gibson-inspired Madame Ho Chi Minh with crispy pickled onion wontons or the spicy tequila-forward Golden Child with goat cheese–stuffed olives. It’s culinary storytelling in a coupe glass.
This isn’t a prix-fixe—it’s a damn mood. Bold flavors dripping in heat, dishes that flirt with your senses, and a table that feels more like a vibe than a meal.
No labels. No rules. Everyone else can chase Spice, but we’re here to stir it.
Why Everyone’s Talking About Phuc Yea
Phuc Yea has earned four consecutive Michelin Bib Gourmand awards, cementing its place as one of Miami’s most creative and crave-worthy dining destinations. It’s been named:
Best Restaurant in MiMo by Miami New Times
One of the Essential 38 Restaurants in Miami by Eater Miami
Among OpenTable’s Diners’ Choice Award winners
And crowned with Best Brunch nods by The Hungry Post and Eater Miami
Family-style experience is $49 per person, plus tax and gratuity. Available for full table participation only.
Subject to change based on availability.
No substitutions or modifications.
📣 PHUC YEA’S NEW HAPPY HOUR JUST HIT DIFFERENT
WED–SUN | 6PM–8PM
Your new favorite pre-game starts right here, hon. We’re turning your golden hour into a full-blown mood with our brand new Happy Hour lineup:
🥂 50% OFF ALL COCKTAILS
🍺 $5.55 Beers | 🍷 $5.55 Wines | 🍶 $5.55 Sake Shots
🥢 $5.55 Chicken OR Broccoli Bao
Whether you’re rolling in after work or revving up for a night out, this is where you want to be. All the vibes, none of the guilt.
DOWNLOAD PDF

Secret Summer
Step into the sultry fantasy world of Giselle and prepare to be captivated by the elevated dining experience she offers. Located in downtown Miami, Giselle boasts a dazzling panoramic setting that is sure to leave you mesmerized. The restaurant combines sophistication with eclectic charm, creating a seductive and extravagant atmosphere.
Embark on a culinary journey at Giselle, where the fusion of Asian, Mediterranean, and French-inspired cuisine will tantalize your taste buds. Indulge in a menu that showcases an exquisite array of flavors and textures, carefully crafted to satisfy even the most discerning palate. From the moment you step into the restaurant through a private elevator, you’ll be transported to a world where every detail has been meticulously curated to create a truly unforgettable experience.

Best Miami Happy Hour: A Seductive Rooftop Escape
As the Miami skyline glows in golden hues, step into Giselle Miami’s Happy Hour—an invitation to unwind, network, and indulge. Sip, savor, and succumb to temptation in a setting where time slows, flavors intensify, and conversation flows effortlessly
Discover her secrets at sundown. Specially priced cocktails and culinary selections.
Happy Hour at the bar and cocktail area, Wednesday – Sunday, 6 pm to 8 pm.

Embrace the Magic of Miami’s Happy Hour
Giselle Miami is more than a destination—it’s an experience. Let the city’s golden hour set the mood, while every sip and every bite pulls you deeper into her world.
Elevate your evening and immerse yourself in the unforgettable experience that only Giselle can offer. Join us for an exceptional Miami happy hour at the bar and cocktail area.
Giselle Miami takes pride in curating an exceptional cocktail program that perfectly complements its sophisticated and eclectic dining experience. Each drink is a work of art, each meticulously crafted to ignite the senses and transport guests into the sultry fantasy world of Giselle. Prepared using only the finest ingredients and techniques. From classic cocktails with a twist to innovative creations inspired by the flavors of Asia, the Mediterranean, and France, there is something for every discerning taste.

Step into the sinfully sweet world of Giselle Miami and indulge in an unforgettable dessert experience. As you enter the dazzling panoramic setting in downtown Miami, be prepared to be captivated by the seductive allure of this eclectic dining establishment.
Giselle’s dessert menu is a tantalizing fusion of Asian, Mediterranean, and French-inspired flavors that will transport your taste buds to new heights. Each decadent dessert is meticulously crafted to perfection, combining unique ingredients and artistic presentation. From the moment you take your first bite, you will be enveloped in a symphony of flavors that dance across your palate, leaving you craving for more.

About the Business
Business owner information
Wei Hao K.
Business Owner
Welcome to Sovereign, the place where the beauty of the East and the West intertwine, creating a harmonious fusion of flavors and cultures. Since our establishment in 2018, our mission has been straightforward: to bring you an extraordinary selection of Asian cuisine that not only tantalizes your taste buds but also foods that perform, all served with unbelievable hospitality.

Sovereign is your inviting "home away from home." Here, you can relish wholesome and delightful dishes and beverages inspired by the diverse culinary traditions of Eastern Asia, all within our thoughtfully curated, cozy setting, perfect for sharing memorable moments with friends, family, or even a cool stranger you met here Sovereign.

At Sovereign, we demonstrate that healthy dining can be an exhilarating and dynamic journey. Our menu ranges from fresh and vibrant poke bowls to artisanal boba teas and unique homemade Asian specialties, each dish infused with the bold and vibrant flavors of Asia. Whether you're a health-conscious twenty-something, a dedicated student, an active athlete, a determined dream chaser, a busy soccer mom, a proud dog mom, an avid foodie, or anyone else, our diverse offerings cater to your preferences and desires.
…
Read more

our name?

An immigrant love story
heartwarming flavors of
homemade-style
Chef Yu Bi and Dr. Lei, originally from China,
Asian cuisine met at Florida International University on
107th Ave in SW Miami, where they bonded
over their shared love for food and dreamed of
Chef Yu Bi and Dr. Lei founded 107 Taste, bringing opening a home-style Asian restaurant together.
their passion for food and hospitality to life, creating
an unforgettable dining experience for all. Years passed, they got married and settled into
a home near the FIU campus on 107th Ave,
Inspired by her grandmother's unbeatable recipes, where they shared their dreams and aspirations.
Chef Yu Bi uses traditional Asian flavors and cooking
techniques to transport South Florida to an authentic Fueled by their passion and determination, Chef
dinner in an Asian home. Yu Bi and Dr. Lei finally opened 107 Taste,
located on 107th Ave, close to FIU. The name
Her grandmother, Yuanfang Pu "107 Taste" is a tribute to the road that

in the 1960s, and Chef Yu's their passion for Asian cuisine with the South

from a young age when she home for life.
began cooking for her friends
and family. For Chef Yu Bi and Dr. Lei, 107 Taste is more
than just a business venture; it symbolizes their

allergen chart
2 Hour limit. Entire party must order from the same menu. Offer valid for dine in only, no to-go orders. All food must be consumed at the restaurant:
Leftovers cannot be taken home. Extra charges will be applied to unfinished food.
Maximum 2 split checks per party (table). Children 4 & under are free. Children 5 to 10 years old are half price.
Certain menu items do NOT include nuts, nut oils, or traces of peanuts, but have sesame oil.
Pork Belly Disclaimer: some cuts may contain rib cartilage (gristle) on Korean style pork belly (samgyubsal). Please use caution while chewing.
Consuming raw or undercooked meats, poultry, seafood, shellfish, eggs or unpasteurized milk may increase your risk of foodborne illness*
Warning: CCTV cameras are in operation on these premises.
We reserve the right to refuse service to anyone.

raw_text:
Organic Vegan Cafe in Fort Lauderdale / Hollywood / Dania Beach - Zen Mystery
Open: Wed-Sat 11:30 AM- 2:00 PM & 6:00 PM-10:00 PM
Home

Gift Cards
On TV!
Organic Vegan Cafe in Fort Lauderdale / Hollywood / Dania Beach
You are here:
Home
/
Organic Vegan Cafe in Fort Lauderdale / Hollywood / Dania Beach
Our dishes are ALWAYS organic, vegan and gluten-free, prepared on site daily.
Organic Vegan Cafe in Fort Lauderdale Area
1 mile South of Fort Lauderdale Airport (FLL)
Starters
$
.
Red Lentil Sweet Potato Soup
A warming and satisfying assortment of seasonally available vegetables. Made from scratch; a reminder of how mama would’ve made it. Just better!
$
.
Hummus & Veggies
Slow steamed sprouted garbanzo beans lightly seasoned with spices and paired with carrots and celery for dipping.
$
.
Save-the-Tuna Pate & Fresh Veggies
Seafood inspired yet fish free, our pate is a mix of dulse flakes with crunchy celery and onions in a sunflower-based spread with freshly cut assorted veggies.
Salads
$
.
Green Tara Salad
Simple and colorful, a bowl of lettuce, shredded carrots, purple cabbage and juicy tomatoes complimented with our house dressing.
$
.
Sesame Kale Salad
Hand-massaged shredded kale mixed with carrots, purple cabbage, black currants, sesame seeds and sunflower seeds, mixed with sesame oil and tamari.
$
.
Cashew Cream Potato Salad
Quartered russet and purple sweet potatoes mixed with celery, carrots, and peas, blended cashews, black Himalayan salt, nutritional yeast and lemon juice.
$
.
Quinoa Salad
A delicious mixture of quinoa, parsley, chickpeas, carrots, mustard vinaigrette with sliced tomatoes and our house dressing.
$
.
Big Denis Salad
Enjoy a bowl of fresh mixed greens topped with your choice of three items complimented with a side of our house dressing. A great choice to satisfy your inner hunger while maintaining a sense of lightness. Chose three: Save the Tuna Pate, Hummus, Cashew Cream Potato Salad, Sesame Kale Salad, Pad Thai, Quinoa Salad, Community Bowl, Soup
$
.
The Evelyn Salad
Enjoy a huge plate of (half) fresh mixed greens and half kale salad topped with your choice of two items, Avocado, and all veggies available!! Complimented with a side of our house dressing. This is our biggest salad YET!!! Chose two: Save the Tuna Pate, Hummus, Cashew Cream Potato Salad, Pad Thai, Quinoa Salad, Community Bowl
Mains
$
.
Community Bowl
Brown rice tossed with peas, carrots and chickpeas and yummy spices, drizzled with our house dressing, and sliced tomatoes.
$
.
Live Pad Thai
A guilt-free version of an old time favorite. A mix of raw almond butter sauce and veggies intermingled with a heaping serving of kelp noodles.
$
.
Save-The-Tuna Roll
A roll for all you lovers of Save-the-Tuna Pate! Made with rainbow veggies including cucumber, bell pepper, carrots, purple cabbage and greens.
$
.
Bento Box
Sharing with company or simply can’t decide? The Bento Box gives a combination plate of three or five delicious choices in sharable portions. Choose from: Save the Tuna Pate, Hummus, Pad Thai, Community Bowl, Quinoa Salad, Kale Salad, Potato Salad, and Soup.
$
.
Lentil Quinoa Loaf
We offered it during Thanksgiving, and it was delicious. Many of you pleaded we add it to the menu. And we listened. Made with lentils, quinoa, lots veggies, a little magic and love. On salad or community bowl / On Quinoa Salad or Kale Salad / Patty Only
$
.
Lina’s Crab Cake
The most delicious and addicting! In this vegan crab cakes, you will find delicious chickpeas, bell peppers, red onions, kelp powder, and spices topped off with homemade cashew cream mayo and capers. On salad or community bowl / On Quinoa Salad or Kale Salad / Patty Only
$
.
Buddha Burger
Hand-made, homemade from scratch from our kitchen to yours! In this vegan burger, you will find delicious black beans soaked and sprouted and steamed, brown rice, gluten-free oats, and lots and lots of veggies. On salad or community bowl / On Quinoa Salad or Kale Salad / Patty Only
Sides

Any berry available and banana blended to perfection for berry lovers.

The best of South Florida tropical fruits mixed together to cool you all year around: coconut manna, mango, and banana.

Blue Monkey

Almond Chocolate Truffle

vegan, organic, soy-free, gluten-free ice cream. Various flavors.

Delicious banana soft serve ice cream with one topping: cacao nibs, walnuts, pecans, gojis, or raisins. Extra toppings $2 each.

Shochu (Asian Vodka)
Shochu, a smooth spirit from Japan is often compared to vodka. This spirit is lower in alcohol and made from a variety of grains. In the past few years, Shochu has experienced a huge boom across Asia, thanks to its light and varied styles. It is best served straight on the rocks, or with our fresh squeezed juices. Kanpai!
Iichiko Silhouette
Iichiko to be distilled only once, to preserve maximum flavor and character, but with an elegant, aromatic nose and a very smooth finish. Iichiko is made from 100% two-row barley, fermented with koji making it a premium class of shochu known as honkaku shochu

CONTACT
CATERING PLATTERS &
LIVE SUSHI CHEF EXPERIENCE
Corporate Events
CONTACT US FOR MORE INFO
Private Events
Weddings, Birthdays, etc.
ABOUT US
KUFFO Restaurant is Inspired by my grandmother  and her love for quality and cultural food. After relocating to the United States when I was 17 years old I saw opportunities to further develop my own creativity in the culinary industry. I then proceeded to venture in to my own business where I had the opportunity to refine my culinary techniques. I have decided to open KUFFO in the summer of 2020. A restaurant fully dedicated gourmet Asian Fusion Cuisine located in Country Walk. The branding of the restaurant is her. KUFFO has a menu of infused flavors inspired by global travels. While cooking is my passion my real joy comes from making my guests happy. Whether it is putting on an event, providing catering, or serving food in my restaurant it’s all about the experience.
FERNANDO  VARGAS
KUFFO  Founder
©2020 by KUFFO ASIAN FUSION CUISINE.

BAGEL WITH ARTISANAL CREAM CHEESE

EGGS AND HAM
Two "steamed scrambled" eggs with grated Cheddar Cheese served with Black Forest Ham and baguette toast; drizzled with extra virgin olive oil.
EGGS AND SPINACH
Two "steamed scrambled" eggs with Crumbled Feta served with sautéed fresh spinach and baguette toasts; drizzled with extra virgin olive oil.
FRENCH TOAST
Our delicious baguette with cinnamon honey, powdered sugar, orange zest, and fresh berries, served with your choice of cinnamon honey or maple syrup.
NUTELLA FRENCH TOAST
Our delicious baguette with Nutella, cinnamon honey, powdered sugar, orange zest, and fresh berries, served with your choice of cinnamon honey or maple syrup.

Menus
À La Carte Lunch
À La Carte Dinner
BUSINESS LUNCH
LES COCKTAILS
CINQ À SEPT
Wine BY THE GLASS
Our Food
The aim with every dish we serve at LPM is to create a mouthful of food that will not be forgotten – and which you cannot find or reproduce elsewhere. Behind that is a journey to explore the essential joy at the heart of the ingredients of the Riviera that we take as our inspiration. Starting, of course, on the Côte d'Azur and the Ligurian coastline, but extending around all the shores of the Mediterranean. The sun-soaked artichokes, lemons, olives, courgettes, tomatoes, peppers and girolles, the freshest seafood, meat and pasta: they lead everything.

FALL MENU 195
POUR COMMENCER
Royale crémeuse de foie gras voilée d’une émulsion lactée au Maury ″Vieilles Vignes″
Foie gras royale, parmesan foam, essence of Maury ″Vieilles Vignes″
*** 1st COURSE (CHOICE OF) ***
LE COEUR DE PALMIER
Marine et servi avec de la peche, la verveine citronnee at latiue
Marinated heart of palm salad with peach, baby gem lettuce and verbena
*LE KAMPACHI
Servi cru avec un gazpacho vert à la saveur estivale
Kampachi crudo, tomatillo and pickled green grapes, sea beans
*LE BOEUF WAGYU
Servi cru avec crème de sarrasin, vinaigrette à la truffe, chips aux grain de lin
Served raw “tartare style”, buckwheat cream, truffle dressing, flax seed crisps
*** 2nd COURSE (CHOICE OF) ***
LA GRENOUILLE
Marine au babeurre, gnocchis aux oignons verts, sauce romesco
Buttermilk marinated frog legs, scallion gnocchi and romesco
LE RIS DE VEAU
En croustillant, poivre de szechuan, noix de cajou, légumes marinés
Crispy veal sweetbread, szechuan pepper jus, cashew, pickled vegetables
*LES OURSINS
Et la carotte en ravioli, saucee curry legere au potironrelevee de togarashi
Sea urchin, carrot ravioli, pumpkin coconut curry, togarashi
*** MAIN COURSE (CHOICE OF) ***
LA SOLE
Accompagnée d’une fleur de courgette farcie, beurre blanc tomaté
Dover sole, stuffed squash blossom, tomato infused beurre blanc
LE FLETAN
Confit a la l’huile d’olive, servi avec des salsifis, de la vanille et feuille de figuier
Olive oil poached icelandic halibut, salsify, vanilla, fig leaf oil
LE BISON
Cuit en feuilletage, duxelles de champignons et blettes, jus au vin rouge
Filet of bison wrapped in laminated pastry, swiss chard, mushrooms, red wine jus
LE SANGLIER
Enveloppé de bacon, servi avec des girolles, des rampes et petits pois
Wild boar tenderloin wrapped in bacon, chanterelle mushrooms and snap peas
*** DESSERT (CHOICE OF) ***
LA SPIRALE DE POMME
Avec une bavaroise a la chartreuse, une genoise caramel et un biscuit speculoos
Apple spiral, chartreuse cream, caramel sponge cake, spiced cookie
LE CHOCOLAT SENSATION
Crémeux onctueux au chocolat guanaja, glace au chocolat blanc et émietté de biscuit oréo
Guanaja chocolate crémeux, white chocolate ice cream, oreo cookie crumble
*Consuming raw or undercooked meats, poultry, seafood, shellfish, or eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness
Our menus reflect the changing seasons, local produce and inventory, allowing chefs to experiment with new flavors and combinations regularly; therefore, dish items are subject to change.
